text:
Hazy , brown color . Medium sized, off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt and dried fruits. Sweet and malty. Dried fruits in aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is caramel, molasses, dark fruit, slight booze, it smells great. Appearance is dark brown, hazy, light brown head. Taste is robust, dark fruit, caramel, booze, earthy hops, roasted malt, molasses, strong but good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, a pretty bitter but sweet aftertaste. Overall, this is pretty good.

Dense chestnut color with a moderate, but stable sized dark beige head. Big sweet malt scents. Some mild resin and smoke. A bit meaty. Flavors start with dark caramel, and a bit of wintergreen. Smooth and thick, with enough zip to keep it lively. Finish is rather dry, yet the linger has some nutty and toasted malt. Nice Alt. 12/12

From bottle. Beer pours dark brown, with little cappuccino foam. Aroma is inviting, with cherries and fruits under spirit. Body is medium. Taste is wonderfully balanced between sweet and bitter, going from the former to the latter. More feelings, like some chocolate and licorice. A great beer!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle @ home, aged 2 years. Pours a brown liquid with a medium beige head. Sweet aroma with dark dried fruits, toffee, caramel, biscuits, plums, slighly vinous raisins and herbs. Taste is smooth and medium to big bodied with average duration. Flavor is vinous with plums, biscuits, brown sugar, herbs, bitter chocolate, anise.bitter finish.
16.9oz bottle - nose is nutty, caramel and a little spice bread. Tastes like old old ale. Tasty but just a tad off. Cant find a date to check. Sweet.

(Bottle) Dark reddish brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, slightly toasty nose with crisp-bread, burnt sugar, treacle toffee, a touch of rye and caramel. Malty, roasted taste with notes of burnt sugar, caramel, treacle-toffee, some coffee, crisp-bread, toast and a gentle spicy bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Possibly and bit hard and aggressive, but interesting and quite tasty. Quite nice.
Bottiglia, una cannonata di malto mitigato da altrettanto luppolo...da non sottovalutare

500 ml bottle. Hazy brown color with a small tan cap. Tangy toasted malt nose. Interesting funky flavor. Notes of burnt toast, Worcestershire sauce, microwaved raisins and cardamom. Bitter hops in finish. Nuff said.

37.5cl bottle from koelschtrinker! Pours hazy dark red brown colour with a huge good lasting beige head. Aroma of wood, dark malt and alcohol. Taste of dry fruits, red berries, wood, caramel, interesting!

Bottle. Poursa murky brown color with a small head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and bit of fruity sweetness. Taste of roasted malt, coffee, bit of chocolate and dark fruit. Has a coffee bitterness that lingers a bit. Medium body, has a bit of a gritty texture but that just ands to the character of this beer. Interesting beer worth checking out.

500 ml. Dark brown-black with a lasting creamy disc of foam. Smells of chocolate, caramel, green herb and a touch of hickory smoke. Flavors of cafe mocha and toffee are bittered on the back end by ash, cardboard and hints of citrus. Medium body has medium carbonation and a good balance.

Pour is a dark muddy river water brown with a small tan head. Aroma is full of dark fruit some sticky caramel malt and a bit of smoke. Flavor is a brown sugar sweetness to start then comes a thick and syrupy malt that gives off a decent toffee and dark fruit. Finish is has a bit of and black licorice. This was a sold alt beer although its a bit sweet for me. Plenty of heavy, thick and chewy malt give this beer plenty of flavor.
Bottle. Deep brown in color with a light tan, small head. Aroma was light toffe, with very slight hoppy notes. Taste is very similar. Smoky caramel upfront with a light bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with off white head. Nose is bread crust and caramel. Taste adds some smokey bitterness.
Bottle share at Evernote in Redwood City, CA. Malt bomb to hoppy twang. Eine der erfreulichen Seiten dieses Berufs ist...
Alaskan makes the only altbier Ive tried before this one. This is much, much better although Ive found I dont love the style. Sampled at World of Beer Fest, Milwaukee.
Bottle. Murky shit (as my friend ChrisO would say) with an offwhite head. . Malty bready grassy aroma. Caramell malty bready flavour. Really a bad beer...
Bottle at Bar Hop. Drink at room temperature! when malt and spice drink well, with noble hops or English hops in the finish.Dark brown.
Tämligen traditionell i stilen, en ton av sötma och en aning bränt. Mörkt brun och en aning grumlig. Funkar.

Bottle - 500ml. Hazy dark copper body with a thin off-white foamy head. Nice malty aroma with fruity, brown sugar, and vanilla hints. Its robust malty/hoppy taste carries oaky notes. Ends with a long bittersweet finish. Interesting.
Bottle from McTapps, thanks Sabine. Pours mud brown with a little sediment. Supposedly a hoppy altbier, typical boozy alt no additional hop kick. Its Ok but nothing special.

Marrom escura, quase opaca. Espuma abundante de curta duração. Aroma de ameixas e lúpulo, levemente amadeirado. Sabor amadeirado com notas de ameixas e melado. Retrogosto com final ácido, ligeiramente defumado. Muito saborosa.
33cl, brewed by Göller. Fresh intense, slightly malty beer. Intense fruity, fresh. Nice bitterness, not too intense, nice moderate sourness. Fresh, nice bittered.

0.33l bottle. Chestnut, offwhite head. Fruity and hoppy aroma with nutty and wooden undertones, a bit dubbel-like. Medium body, quite dry chewy body, some sparkles. Wood/barn dryness, chestnuts, citrus from the hops, light berries. Im not too fond of the dry minerally notes, but it certainly packs some flavors.

Bottle from Nathanials. Medium chestnut brown, Very murky. Thin head, spotty soapy lacing and zero retention. Nose has a lot going on, plenty of dark fruit, caramel, some spiciness. Mouthfeel is semi balanced with the carbonation acting as a foil for the sweetness. But it is still a bit too sweet. Overall this is missing something after showing promise.

dark brown, but bright when held to the light. 3mm medium-coarseness head. Fades at a moderate rate to film. Aroma is light mix of caramel, dates, and raisin, some dark sweet-bread dough, with a touch of forest in the background. Body is medium-medium-light, starchy, slightly oily and gritty, medium-light carbonation of moderate coarseness. Light burn but scratchy, prolonged wool texture. Flavor is twig and sap with a light turbinado sugar sweetness, clean. Hint of floral herbs. Pleasant aftertaste of vegetation and wood. Overall, a nice big alt; it doesnt live up to their description though. I didnt get any smoke even though it was on my radar.

Bottle share 08/02/15 on IC2012 with Theydon and Wingman,

Pours a dark amber to gold with off white head, 
Notes of malty caramel, hints of mild fruityness, caramel, malts and a hint of dark chocolate. Nice in the snow !

Pours reddish amber with a good sized soapy beige head. The aroma has brown sugar, molasses, horehound candy and the alt slant to the maltiness. It has a medium frothy body with a pretty good amount of carbonation. The taste starts much sharper than the aroma with some metallic/mineral aspects, light spice and weird sharpness. The finish is astringent and offputting. Guess I like this brewery except for their alts.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Dark amber colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Malt, fruit, caramel, resin.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, caramel, malt, some chocolate.
Cerveja forte e equilibrada. Aroma lupulado e sabor de caramelo e ameixa. Seu final defumado dá força a cerveja.
Gegen Original verglichen. Ähnliche Farbe. Hoppeditz riecht rauchiger, original eher blumig. Schwache Rezenz. Orig. ist weicher & blumiger.
500ml bottle. Pours a brown with red tint and off white head. Dark fruit and malt aroma. Caramel, dark fruit, smokiness. Really good beer.

Bottle from Beer52.

Such a complex beer!

Has an initial smell I can only compare to well aged iberico ham. Imagine the oily ham, well thats it. Add fruits and there you have it. Weird I know.
On the taste theres initial citrus then dark, winter fruits, which are quite flavoursome. Then there is a caramel taste from the malts. Then nuts, roasted chestnut and hazelnuts, then a nice smoky yet alcoholic finish. Lovely lovely beer!

Location/Date:Bottle in December 2014.
Appearance: Pours a dark maroon brown. 
Aroma: Aroma of caramel.
Taste: Caramel, nutty, lightly bitter.
Palate:Medium light body.
Summary: Thanks Dave! I really enjoyed this.

Growler from Perfect Pour. Pours opaque dark brown with a medium, creamy and bubbly beige head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is moderate caramel and toast malt, medium earthy and spicy hops with notes of dates and plums. Flavor is sweet and rich caramel, toast, bread malt, dark fruits, medium earthy and spicy hops, medium bitterness and a sweet finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation.

Bottle (trade with McTapps - thank you, Sabine!); pours a cloudy caramel color with thin beige head; sweet caramel aroma with hints of nuts and alcohol; sweet taste with caramel, nuts, and yeast with hints of citrus; light bitter finish; sehr gut!

330ml bottle.
Pours a deep copper with a beige head.
Malty, robust aroma, caramel, hops, yeast.
Dry, medium body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty taste, caramel, hops, yeast, dried fruit, chocolate, fanit smoke/phenols. (2014-11-23)

Pours a clouded rusty brown...aroma is sweet and musty much like a ripe apple cider....flavor is a lot like a Belgian brown ale...rich,complex with a long wet finish...not bad but not what I expected of a sticks alt.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Muddy brown color with beige head that goes away completely. Aroma seems kind of yeasty with some dark malts, like a belgian dark ale. Taste is on the bitter side but also a bit sour. Aftertaste is hoppy bitter. Medium body with light carbonation. Not really my style of beer.
A complex beer in many features. I like the star in mouth with a full body and thin texture a bit sour with a soft carbonation and a long finish

33cl flesje bij Zeezicht, Breda
Alcoholpercentage van 7,5%
Uitgeschonken in blanco bokaal

Uiterlijk: bruinkoper kleurig met minimale schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: ijzer, bittertje, kruidig, donker fruit, hoppig 

Conclusie: aparte smaak, even wennen gedurende het drinken 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle trade with Mctapps.
Couleur pourpre un peut trouble, mousse qui disparait. Nez fort malté caramel. Gout malté caramel, forte amertume houblonné, épicée, un peu de noisettes, note de chocolat et café. Corps bien cremeux et rond en bouche. bonne amertume longue en fin de bouche. Pas mal!
Thanks Sabine!

Bottle 33cl kindly shared by Calisky. A dark amber beer with low head. Nose is on caramel and toasted caramel, aroma is on caramel, toasted caramel, light chocolate, toffee, grassy hops, good bitterness, bit of tannins, nutty, toasted brown bread, nice body. Finish is again on caramel variations with still a robust bitterness and long duration on aftertaste, good.
bottle from beer 52 not a style i would normally go for but i quite enjoyed it nice malty hoppy taste going on not too bitter one to have a try of

Bottle. Well, what an intense and multilayered malty beer this is. Caramel, raisin bread, madeira, lots of licorice, nuts and some citrusy hops shining through all that. Solid body and an excellent balance of sweet and bitter notes. Impeccable flavour depth, while it manages to retain a dangerous drinkability. Beyond awesome.

Botella de 33 cl en el lúpulo en el momento el 25-10-2014. fecha de cons pref para 01-04-2015 F. Color oscuro marrón con espuma también oscura y poco persistente desapareciendo por completo hacia la mitad. Aromas y sabores maltosos algo tostados y ligeramente de caramelo. Final amargo algo seco y mas o menos persistente. Buena sensación alcohólica con sus 7.5 vol. Normal.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en tienda XXXII. Color marron. Sabor a malta, caramelo, ligeramente a lupulo, amargo.

330ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 14-10-2014.
BBD: 01-04-2015.
In short: tasty amber ale.
Pours dark amber with little off white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Roasty, caramel, malty aromas. Light body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is malty, roasty, some sweet, spicy and finishes a bit dry. Quite enjoyable.
Aug. 22, 2014. Bottle at beerbistro. Sweet dried fruit aroma. Warm reddish brown with white head. More bitter than expected but no overly so. Hints of smoke.

(bottle, 33cl) Hazy, murky brown colour with a beige and short foamy layer. Dark malty aroma with notes of chocolate, caramel, dried fruits, also a tad vinous, Port-like flavours are detectable. Moderately sweet and rounded bitter flavour, medium bodied with a flat carbonation (bottle was not perfectly capped). Deep malty taste with notes of caramel, chocolate, liquorice and lighter dried/raisiny fruity notes; the initially herbal hoppy spice gets stronger towards the bitter-sweet and still malt-accented finish. A bit flat on carbon, nevertheless likeable. 07.X.14
Many thanks for this bottle to Nisse666. Pours dark brown white head Nose/taste of caramel, tree sap, pine and light molasses

Bottle - pours dark amber with a fizzy sparse brown head which bubbles for a while before disappearing. Very hazy if yeast is poured in. Aroma of lemon, cocoa and chocolate with some lime and pineapple notes. Taste of roasted malt, grass and cocoa. Some molasses and dark sugar. Medium bitterness and warming notes. Medium body, medium carbonation. Delightful.

Labelled as doppelsticke alt. definitely drier than any doppelbock. Malty and a bit rich. Dry and slightly more bitter in the finish. Slight plum fruit, dough, dark malts and a hit of hops. Pretty good, but not a standout in a ever crowded market..."

500ml draught 
7.5% ABV 
The Beerbistro (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
September 12, 2014 
The beer poured a hazed dark golden brown with a thin tan coloured cap. The aroma was grainy, with weak herbal hops, and caramel notes. The mouthfeel was medium bodied with average carbonation. The flavour was burnt caramel, some wooden flavours, and a weak hop presence.

Bottle from Whole Foods Bowery. Dark brown with orange, fine, low heqd. Rich mqlty nose, carqmel, chocolate, raisins, Prunes. Rich, lovely malt flavor, fudge, cake, dried fruits. Full and meaty, and not too sweet. Bit of alcohol. Very nice. Good bitter finish.

Bottle from European Summer Secret Santa. Many thanks McTapps! Dark brown/reddish colour. Creamy beige foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet aroma of caramel and dark fruit with bitter finish. Light hoppy aftertaste. Decent beer.

Dark brown colour, clear, with rubin shine, and a small beige head. Smell is hoppy, vegetable hops, but also a bit resin, and also roasted malts, even some smokeyness. Taste is malty, roasted, some toffee, with a good bitterness too, intense. Full mouthfeel.
I dont know if its a perfect Altbier, since I never tried before, but its really a very good beer.
Bottle, 7.5%. Fruity aroma, candylike. Almost clear dark red brown colour. The flavour is caramelly, sweetish. Sugary and candylike, but not sweet as such. Roasted and dry finish.
Clear brown color with tan head. Aroma of caramel. Taste is sweet with a long bitter finish. Oily texture. Well balanced.

Bottle from McTapps & MichaelAwesome - thank you! Pours slightly hazy dark ruby / copper brown with stable off-white head. Sweetish aroma of malt, caramel and fruit, with notes of dust. Dusty flavour, with sweetish notes of malt and caramel and bitter, hoppy touches. Bitter aftertaste. Well-balanced and enjoyable. Good.

500mL bottle from State Line, love to see those recycling rings. Nose is very sweet, thick malt with brown sugar and various Maillard, earth, sticky grapes, light spice, faint roast and just beautiful aromatic complexity. Pours dark brown with a dense and sudsy tan head, lots of lace; really dialing everything in so far. Taste is very sweet with medium bitterness, light grain and a touch of chalk rising above other minerals, otherwise more of the aforementioned deep malt complexity and some low-lying fruitiness -- toffee, faint prune, anise. The bitterness turns somewhat astringent in the aftertaste but its not bad, and the hops really come forward with earth, wood, and spice to unleash a massive bite not anticipated by the nose alone. A gritty, lightly dank hop bite, herbal around the edges. Slow-arriving but strong warmth and a little bit of fumy fire from the alcohol. Full body. The presumed decoction might have been boiled a little too long, as the malt starts to resemble broth/bouillon after a while, but otherwise Id say this is about as perfect a Doppelsticke as youll be able to find, and a rival to the best Doppelböcke.

Klar, brun-orange med ett skum av små brun-orange bubblor. Doft: Kanderat socker, humle, lager, jord, rostade nötter, lakrits, alkohol. Smak: Malt, humle, jord, bränt socker, svagt av dåligt kaffe, frukt. Gillar öl med beska, dock är beskan i eftersmaken här inte så trevlig. Det påminner om industri lager beska.

Bottled (thanks McTapps!). Deep amber colour, small beige head. Aroma is resin, spruce, some sweet maltiness along with some toffee. Flavour is resin, grass, some toffee, ripe fruits and mild toasted notes. Quite tasty, a bit like a wellhopped doppelbock.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear ruby red with a tan medium sized head. Aroma is caramel, dark fruits, gooseberries. Taste is sweet maltycaramel, light roasted, light alcohol. Medium bodied.
Thinnish body for the style. Medium sweetness of hard caramels, little hop presence. Touch charred. Easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours in dark caramel amber body with medium to high creamy tan head. Aroma has strong dark fruity character, herbs, nuts, light roasty and caramel. Taste has high earthy bitterness, evident alcohol, low to medium woody sweetness. Body is medium, low carbonation.

Truly a blend of malt and hops aroma. Taste is of bread and light caramel. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth a weak moment. Mediocre beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Appearance: Cloudy fine nutty color with a thick tan head. Ok lacing. Aroma: Nutty, mild citric hoppy, malty and mild fruity.Palate: Medium (+) body. Tad and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Pleasant fruity, a fine hop profile, a citric tail, bready and malty. Well hidden alcohol.Overall impression: A really pleasant and fine balanced altbier! Recomendable.Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget web order, Sweden.

Bottled:Pours dark reddish brown with a slight haze. Dense head.Aroma is all about sweet, malty toffee. Theres some chocolate as well.Taste is more more sweet, malty toffee leading to a hoppy finish.Pretty good, but perhaps not as balanced as one would wish.
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2015 From Beer Temple - Reddish brown color. Low carbonation. Smooth feel. Quite nice, a hint of doppelbock characteristics. Minerals. Serving: Bottle

Mid red brown pour. Aroma of paper and berries. Distinct tangy yeast of Freigeist seems muted. Tastes berries pepper yeast. Alcohol hidden. Some sourdough notes with a sweet upturn at end. Dry finish some sediment on tongue. Good, but not the best style for Freigeists style.

30.05.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel malts, roasted nuts, hay, "knekk", grass, chocolate. Taste is kind of harsh and burnt, grass, harsh hops, burnt caramel, pine needles, soap, cardboard, almond essence. Longlasting bitterness, harsh mouthfeel. Meh!!

Bottle from Systembolaget. Cloudy orange/brown beer with a small offwhite head. Malty bready aroma, grassy, sourish notes, caramel, some biscuits, malty bready flavor, caramel, slightly sourish. A bit disappointing.
Nettes Piwo mit einer angenehmen Mischung aus Hopfigkeit und Früchten. Dazu ein klein wenig Säure ergibt durchaus süffige Momente. Fein und mit Pflaumen abgerundet.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Lots of caramel on the nose, malty. Sweet malty smell with lots of caramel. Some roasted sugar. A bit onesided but not bad.

330ml brown bottle. Pours opaque dark mahogany with a small tan head that settled fast, leaving no lacing. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt and syrup loaf. Flavours of caramel, roasted malts, toffee, a hint of lemon peels and alcohol. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, slightly oily texture and average carbonation. Flavour is okay but the aroma has an odd funkiness to it that Im unable to identify, overall a decent Altbier.

Bottle from SB cons 2014-05-17 Göteborg
AR: wee yeasty, boiled potatoes, chocolate
AP: dark mahogny, stouthy/frothy crème brown head
F: fizzy, chocolate, dry, initially chocolate, malt bread, liqurice, salty
Dark brown color with tan head. Strong malty aroma, raisins. Sweet taste with dark malt body. Also aome bitterness.

Flaska från SB. Mörkbrun, klar vätska, lågt snabbt försvinnande skum. Malttungt, alkoholvarmt med rejäl sötma, lätt maltsyrligt och med påtaglig gräsig och örtig beska. Honung, mjuk pepparkaka, läder och ganska jästig som det mesta av Freigeist. Söta smaker, men torr munkänsla, lite som en platt, aningen för besk BW. Inte i klass med Uerige men annorlunda på ett trevligt sätt.

Pours out of the bottle in a deep dark brown colour with low airy head and smooth body. Aroma of prunes and dark roasted nuts. Taste of plums, prunes, cookies, milk, cream, nuts and malt. A very nice beerwith a light sour and dusty touch. Enjoyed it a lot.
Bottle from SB. Dark amber with a medium tan head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, fruit, hops and bitterness. Medium to full body with a long, dry finish.

Bottle. Pours somewhat hazy red/copper/brown. One finger head, some lacings. Aroma is unpasteurized cheese, also some more typical altbier aroma like dark fruits, burnt sugar, malt and some hops. Rather thin however. Taste is kind of rough, with hops, caramell, burnt sugar, finishes agressive and hoppy, some grass and alcohol. Medium body, medium carbo though sticky bubbles, light sticky texture. Not a perfect altbier, though OK if served at a higher temperature.
@ Ölprovning på Havregatan. Flaska (330ml) från Systembolaget (30:-). Dansk ostbutik i doften, även något småunken, charkuterier, karamell, hög sötma. Avslutningen är torr och besk.
@Ölprovning på Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget. Arom: Dansk ostbutik, russin. Smak: Den ganska tunna smaken bjuder på karamell och en skum beska.
Nej, ingen favorit. Smakar först inte så mycket, men lång besk eftersmak. Lite smak av alkohol och läder.

E: brown/ red, small head and much lasing. N: sweet malts, yeast, caramel, dark fruits. All aromas are quite boring.
T: yeast, roasted, some hops, caramel, dried dark fruits. 
M: a bit dry. Some bitterness. Good amount of small bubbles. Thin body. 
Ok but not more than that.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Cloudy dark/copper brown, small head. Earthy roasty nose. Mid dry with medium body and clean, hard mouthfeel. Resin and licorice. Shallow and harsh with notes of metal in an aggressive bitter finish. Primitive. Oh, why do we get swamped with these beers in Sweden, when the selection of good German beers here are so extremely lackluster?
Deep brown pour from bottle with white head. Earthy caramel smell. Caramel and nice dry hops taste. A characterful Salt.

Aroma: Spiced bread with caramel; some butterscotch qualities; a touch of apple. Appearance: Murky dark brown pour with a foamy tan head that dissipated into a sticky ring. Flavor: Semi-sweet, spicy bread that is followed by a lingering noble hop presence. Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, flat carbonation, lightly bitter finish. Overall: A pretty good beer, but I have the feeling that the bottle I consumed was a little old.

500 ml bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a lingering ring of tan foam. Aromas of tootsie rolls caramel and light smoke. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a smooth finish. Flavors of caramel, tootsie roll and light smoke with a smooth moderatly bitter caramel finish.

pours cloudy almost murky dark copper-reddish with a small light beige cap, little retention, no lacing per say. toffee and caramel - loads of diacetyls, some lightly roasted and smoked nuts, doughy and buttery fruitiy malts - raisins, booze, very spicy - pepper but also licorice, grass, clean yeast, salt, lots of brown sugar with a maple syrup touch. moderate to low carbonation, medium body - oily and a bit sticky, short to medium long bitter grassy-piney-earthy finish. smooth mouthfeel and almost balanced. awkwardly o-k.

bottle pour..darker caramel color with a slight white head resting atop..nose is malty..bit grainy..touches of honey and molasses..mouthfeel is quite good with a well done subdued smokiness that doesnt overpower everything and lead to a smokey mess.but provides the ideal smoke character matched with a medium bodied hoppy presence..a novice to this style but this is by far the most enjoyable freigeist offering I have had to date..nice offering sebastian well done..

From 500ml bottle. A dark mahogany in glass. Very dark. Beige head. Nose is lots of sweet malts (think molasses chews), some caramel and nuttiness. Also, surprise, traces of hops. Very inviting. Taste is malty, but not cloying. Raisins. Fruit liquor. Bitterness on the back end. Velvety palate. Drinks smoothly.

Bottle. I don't really know what to make of this. Maybe this was a bad bottle - smelled and tasted a little off at first, then settled into some weird flavours as it warmed. Malty aromas of caramel and some subtle dark fruits. Some strange sourness and bitterness, reminiscent of sour milk. Bizarre.
Bottle, shared with Parksy and Grippitis. Dark amber body, tan head that leaves spotty lace. Aroma is caramel with hazelnut. Caramel malts with sharp noble hop character that cuts the finish. Nice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 2/16/2014. Pours red brown with a creamy tan head. Aromas are sweet and malty with dried fruit. Very hoppy for the style and the alcohol content seem higher than it is. Interesting beer.
Bottle. Pours hazy brown, beige head. Nose of toffee, nuts, esters. Flavour is same with some chocolate and dark fruit. Pretty sweet.

Pours a. Thin, off-white creamy head atop an opaque brown body. Mose of ground raisins and bread. Pretty damn sweet - candied malt, breaded notes, and dates. Cloyingly sweet. 500ml bottle. Purchased from Metro Liquors University Heights in Saanich.

500 ml bottle. Pours a very dark mahogany with light with head. Aromas of brown sugar, leather, and toasted malts. Somewhat sweet flavors of caramel, dark fruit/raisins, grass, and malts. Bitter finish. Quite nice.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, dark brown, thin head (well call it a film), lacing nonexistent. Nose is very faint, malt, dark fruit. Mouth is medium bodied, malt forward with some dried fruit, caramelly malt, toast, nice balancing bitterness tying it together, dry finish. Not bad, but Ive had better alts.

Doppelstickme. Rich nuttiness and soothing mouthfeel balanced nicely by a bitter backbone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2011 The head is good, the body dark brown. It smells hopintensive, roasty, aromatic. The taste is intensive, maltaromatic-creamy, hopintensive, bit alcoholic, roasty. Nice!

@Weilands Market, Columbus OH. Hazy dark red amber with a 1" head that stays, heavy streaks of lace. Aroma is tart cherry and malt, notable for me because my nose is no longer dependable. Taste matches aroma, sweet malt with dark fruit moves smoothly to the finish, where it is joined by very light (but sufficient) bittering. Slightly oily, more filling than expected. Very good, not great.

Bottle @ Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. The pours reddish with a small head. The nose is cherry, toast, almond. The taste is more toasted almond. Hot caramel. Toffee shake. Rich malt profile. Medium body, fine carbonation. Good.
Brown pour with tan head. Lots of malts and fruit here. Even kind fruitcake-y. Nice solid body with malt characteristics coming through. Medium to heavy mouthfeel. Pretty good.

11/9/13. Bottle shared by Brent - thanks, dude! Brown pour with a small khaki head that sticks around and laces well. Malty aroma, deep, with bread, toast, caramel, some dark fruits. The flavor follows suit, nicely sweet, some fruitiness and nice bready maltiness. Not bad.

Bottle at chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013 - London. Pours cloudy brown with a light beige froth head. Nose of bread and ripe fruits. Light to medium sweet flavor with bread and semi-ripe dark fruits. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Moderately sweet finish with further bread, toast, raisins. Decent.

Bottle. 7.5%. Best before 03.12. Pours an ugly murky brown with a tan head. Good lacing. Tart to sour aroma, fruity and flowery with a note of horse stable. Flavour is sour and malty with a metallic overtone. Sweetish finish with an intrusive bitterness. Notes of raisins as it warms. Lingering dryness. 05.10.13.
Bready, and toasty. Very nicely balanced between sweet and bitter has a decent amount of hops holding it together.
Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. Cheers Colin! Sweetish cara, woody nose. Some fussels. Some yeastyness. Doppelbock type flavours. Sweetish.

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013 - sourced from Braustelle Erenfeld, 10/08/13. 
Dark amber/light chestnut brown with a thin off white head.
Nose is bready malts, dark fruti, toffee fudge.
Taste comprises bready malts, treacle toffee, pitted fruit, hop notes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation.
Decent drop.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. It pours hazy darkest mahogany brown with a small off-white head. The nose is wood, leather, fruit cake, earth and molasses. The taste is wood, leather, earth, decent bitterness, dirt, dried fruit and light alcohol with a dry, earthy finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Decent.
Carmel and chocolate tones with a bit of pine. Black/brown color.with thin tan cream head. Has a light cream feel with a bit of nickel in the background. Kinda fizzles out with no real bang.

Pours mahogany into an English pint. Tan head with medium retention recedes leaving spotted sheets. Sweet dark nutty caramel aromas. Soft with sweet caramel and toffee upfront turning to bitter roasted nuts before the lasting earthy mocha finish.

Fine, foamy head. Cool artistic label. This beer is named after a traditional flaming puppet. A yeasty, bready aroma with floral and funky notes. It tastes like a dry, hoppy bock, with a bit of a woodsmoke and pipe tobacco. Supposedly this is a version of Dusseldorfs traditional ale. Very good.
Smokey body with a complimentary herbal hop, brown roasty malts and a yeasty finish.

Bottle at PIB, pours an opaque dark mahogany, with a small beige head. Aroma of dried dark fruits, caramel, and some bready malts. Flavour brings out German lager yeast, caramel, and bready malts. Quite dry but caramely, without being sweet. Fairly highly drinkable for a dark lager. Good stuff.

A small, but lasting and dense off-white foam settles above the highly sedimented burnt caramel coloured robe. Concentrated malt flavours. Initially, it feels a bit candy-like, but you quickly realize that the sugariness is more that of a spread over a slice of richly cerealic bread than sheer candiness. Bright nutty overtones all throughout and pleasant smoky undertones contribute complexity to this German sipper. More smoke and breadiness come through as it warms up - yet there is little to no fruitiness, the beer being all about full maltiness. Very fullsome palate, silky on the tongue, with humble bubbles leaving the foreground to the generous malts. There are actually a fair bit of noble hops in here, providing a leafy background that is most welcome, managing to cut through the sweetness that could easily have been overwhelming. In the end, its not something I would like to drink very frequently, but its texture is remarkable and the malt extraction an undeniable exercise in the style. A commendable try.
This brew was delicious all around. Aromas resemble bread, toffee and fruit roll-ups. The flavor was tangy and malty with a pretty decent caramel finish. All in all a fun, unique brew to have around.
Bottle at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated 03082012. Colour is reddish brown with small head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, caramel and malts.
Bottle.  Sweet caramel/molasses barley malt aroma.  Murky chestnut with a small yellowed ivory head. Toasty caramel/molasses malt flavor with a light bitter finish. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Pours a dark ruby with a light haze - compact tan head shrinks to a moderate lace - rich maltiness in the nose - aromas of toffee, raisins, dates, light woodsmoke - light mineral notes and some woody hops - creamy, full texture in the mouth - a lot of rich malt flavors - sweet munich and toasty vienna - quite bitter and hoppy for the style, but it plays well with the toastiness of the malt - flavors of raisin, pumpernickel, mild smoke - lingering bitter and toasty finish, with some drying mineral to cut the sweetness - another solid beer from these guys - I am sold on this brewery.
Bottle shared by nuplastikk. Thanks. Caramel and toffee with a little wood. Really decent beer. I would love to delve deeper into this style.

500 mL bottle purchased at The Davis Beer Shoppe.  The aroma on this is sweet and caramelly with bits of nougat.  Light buttery character as well.  Some stale hops also come through.  Light sherry and oxidation.  Moderately hazy cola-colored body with a medium, strong, foamy cream-colored head.  Good retention.  Starts with a sweet, nutty, caramel maltiness.  Very velvety mouthfeel.  Light burnt character in the middle, and maybe a smidge of buttery diacetyl later on.  Finishes with a bit of a boozy kick.  A different beer, thats for sure.  Not sure this is one of the best altbiers available, though.

Bottle during the Freigeist meet the brewer event @ The BeerMongers...  Poured deep ruby, reddish/mahogany with a nice forming white head.  Nice retention and lacing.  Aroma of malty sugars with some oxidation.  Faint oxidation on this, but in a good way in the sense that it didnt taste stale or too old.  Nice malted sugars, faint toasted grains and a mild bitterness.  Little-to-no yeast character.  Some alcohol complexity.  This was a nice drinking beer.

Freigeist Hoppeditz is a German brew that hits all the right notes. Nice pour with decent head and dark body. Light malty aroma. Taste is a nice blend of malt, hops and a hint of smoke with a nice malt palate. Hoppeditz is good tasting brew brewed in a classic German style.

500 ml bottle. Pours a dark amber with a thick, beige head of foam. In the aroma I get a lot of roasty toffee and caramel notes. Some toasted nuts as well. Im also picking up on some cookie dough and brown sugar. In the taste I pick up on a lot of dark fruit and esters. Soft carbonation with the medium to thick mouthfeel. Very nice doppelsticke!

Woody brown with a short tan head.
Earthy, woody aroma....caramel malt.
Taste is very smooth, malty, caramel.
A slight alcohol bitter.
Very nice.

Bottle shared by nuplastikk...thanks Greg! - Pours mahogany with a bubbly tan head. Nose is light dark bread malt and a bit of herbal hops. Taste is sweet and bready with some grainy notes. Lightly bitter/sweet finish. Slick and not well-carbonated. Not my favorite beer of the night.
Bottle.  Caramel malt and hay aroma.  Brown with moderate head.  Sweet toffee malt, hay, and moderately bitter herbal flavor.  Solid - nice malt flavor.

Bottle shared by Greg, thanks!  Pours a clear light brownish amber with a thin head, the aroma has a good amount of caramel and malt, sweet aroma, the flavor has the same amount, touch of caramel and malt with a sweet finish, not bad at all.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2013 16.9oz bottle.  Translucent brown-tan body.  Foamy edged, oily head.  Unimpressive aroma.  Caramel, sugary flavor.   Reminiscent of great Alts, but not really there.  Sweet and malty, a touch nutty.  Doesnt quite capture the yeasty tones you want in the style.  Not quite there.

On tap at Brasserie V.  Mellow, cask temperature.  Big frothy beige head on top of a thick unfiltered brown body.  Has quite a delicate cask feel, Altstadt reminiscent,letting the malts take center stage.  Not really an Alt, not a rauch, really has the most similarities to an Old Ale, with its berry undertones complementing the caramel and chocolate malts.  Fig, prune, brown sugar.  Unique.

Draft. Pours amber/brown with a medium white head. Aroma of caramel and malt. Malt sweetness upfront and nicely balanced with a bitter hop finish.

Bottled thx to bierkonijn. Brownish color, medium head. Aroma of soft spicy and grassy hop, lots of caramel, soft fruity yeast esters. Clean bitterness in taste, lots of malt body, some sweetness. Lovely balance. Good stuff.
Aroma is malts, light smoke and a hint of sweetness.  The flavor is mild/medium smoked malts, fruit and a tangy/tart finish.

500ml bottle from De Bierkoning in Amsterdam. Pours a deep brown colored body with a finger-width, creamy and frothy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is a bit sweet with lots of caramels and toffees as well as hints of toast, a bit of a grassy note, some bread, a few dark fruits, and touches of roast. Flavor is similar. Sweeter with a good amount of toasty toffees and caramels, but a slight roast note throughout as well as a light earthy hopping. Some bread and a few dark fruits towards the end before this finishes dry and fairly bitter, but sweet and balanced before leaving a lengthy aftertaste. Medium-full body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty solid Doppel Sticke. Bigger and a touch sweet at times, but well balanced with a nice roast note and solid hopping. Good beer.
Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this bottle. Brown with a white head. Aroma is toffee, caramel and floral. Flavor is flowers, toffee, biscuit and alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

500ml bottle [brewed by Braustelle at Brauerei Göller]. Cloudy brownish ruby red colour with average, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, superbly lacing, beige head. Caramel malty aroma with hints of toffee, toast, bitter hoppy overtones. Taste is dry to bitter dark malty, toasty, nuttily, hints of toffee and dark berries.

On tap 4 oz. sample at Pizza Paradiso in DuPont Circle, Washington, DC.

Clear, dark orange-red with large khaki head and very good lacing.

Mild aroma of toffee, toasted malt, yeast, nuts and molasses.

Taste of toffee, roasted malt, toast, earthy yeast and molasses.

Medium body and low/medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is fruity, bread.  The appearance is deep brown/red, white head.  The flavor is fruit, bread, candi sugar.  The finish is sweet, some noble hop bittering.  Medium to medium/thick in body.  Awesome.
Pours a pale orange colour. with nice head and lacing. Taste has some wooden bitterness and some sourness - good for style. Average carbonation. Aroma of malt and wood chips. Tap at Taberna Lupulo.
Spot on recommendation by one of the bartenders at La Taberna Lupulos. Aromatic, malty sweet, balanced hop bitters and warming alcohol. Still, the best beer bar in Puerto Rico.

Bottled. Poured deeper amber with a sticky, well-retained, smoked beige head.  The aroma picked up sweet caramel, vanilla, and nutty malts with leafy and earthy accents.. warm and interesting, but I didnt love it.  The flavor found sweet caramel and nutty notes at the core, with earth, herbal, pine, and black peppery hoppage laced throughout.. fairly tangy and bitter on the long, belly-warming finish.  Medium-bodied and very hoppy for the style.. this grew on me a little.

500ml bottle... word. 

Pours a very hazy reddish color with a solid lightly tan head and good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is very sweet and malty.... lots of toffee... lots of caramel. Not off-putting, fairly inviting... just not always my thing.

The flavor is more toffee and caramel flavor, but with enough bitterness to balance it, which is not as apparent in the aroma. There are some nice roasty notes & some toasted marshmallow. Some spicy hoppiness is nice.... delicious. 

Lively on the tongue... fairly easy to drink of a touch heavy.

37.5cl bottle shared by Shaun.Poured a brown colour with a good sized beige head.Aromas of dark fruit,caramel and toffee which all appeared in the taste alongside some moderate hoppiness.Nice dry finish,both enjoyed this one.
Draft. Rich amber beer with a nice cream head. Caramel aroma. Caramela nd toffee flavor with light dried fruit. Medium bodied. Caramel and toffee linger with light mineral notes.
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is Sourness, roasted malt, yeast, caramel. Flavour is sweet, sour, roasted malt, yeast, caramel, hop. Strange beer.

Bottle from Bine & Vine. Pours dark amber/brown with orange glints and a 3 finger creamy beige head. Aroma is mixed toffee and darkish fruit. Near full bodied. Flavor is not all that sweet, though the flavor is toffee and darkish fruit. Also somewhat dark malt. Pretty good alt. Do prefer them "strong". Finishes dry.
Bottle from Beer Revolution. Pours black with an attractive tan head and a pine aroma. There is a hearty treacle flavor with some hop bitterness. Nicely balanced and tasty with a dry finish.

when the bottle or glass is empty, that is when you get the pine hop aroma. initially with the beer it seems a little citrus like as well. some toffee and prune ,fig or raisin with sweetness and a mild but pronounced hop character. a bit perfume like if let to sit a while and warm up.

A hazed brown alt with a thin mocha head. In aroma, nice vinous malt with grassy hops, grainy and nutty. In mouth, a nice rich musky vinous malt floral and grassy hops, treacle, very good. On tap at Snallygaster DC, Oct. 13 2012.

500ml bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee.  Pours a light brown amber color with an off white head.  Aroma is malty, bready, a little fruity, pear maybe.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, malty, cereal, caramel, toffee, a nice bitter pine hoppiness, with a light bitter finish. Tasty.

Dark orange/amber pour with an off-white head. Toffee and caramel malts on the nose, some fruit esters such as apple and grape, and a hint of cardboard. A hint of chocolate on the finish. Flavor isnt bad. Sweet bread, caramel, and toffee. Some fruit notes, a bit of chocolate, and a very mild spice component. Perhaps a slight smokiness as it warms up.

Bottle shared at Exira Beer Summit 2012. Thanks to adnielsen for sharing.  Pours a deep brown color with white head.  Dark malt, caramel, toffee aroma.  Malty, caramel, slight nutty, toffee, slight smoky flavors.  Nice altbier.

Bottle @ Exira Beer Summit III. Pours a dark orangish brown appearance with a foamy, light brown head. Earthy, rich toffee, chewy malty, a touch spicy aroma. Somewhat smoky, light oaky, caramel, chewy, toasty malty, just a bit herbal, earthy flavor. Fairly high, spicy bitterness but fun to drink. Really nice stuff that it is a true pleasure to receive in Denver. Big thanks to bardwashrind for the recommendation.
Pours a dark caramel color with a cream-colored head.  Aroma of chocolate, caramel, and dark fruit.  Dark fruit flavor with caramel, chocolate, and hint of smoke. Excellent lacing. Very nice!
Pour is brownish..Nose is caramel,chocolate,toffee,dry fruits,roast..Taste is bitter,chocolate,stone fruit,caramel..palate is dry

Bottle.

Head is initially large, frothy, light brown, fully lasting.
Body is hazy dark brown, unfiltered.

Aroma is moderately to heavily malty (cookie, caramel, hazelnuts, bread), moderately hoppy (herbs, flowers, grapefruit), with notes of toffee and honey.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately to heavily bitter.

Medium to full body, velvety/creamy texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic, lightly to moderately astringent.

A very assertive brew in both the malt and hop departments...it starts lusciously rich and sweet in the mouth, but the finish is quite aggressively bitter...a little too much so, which is its only weakness. But the aroma is quite enticing (and surprisingly hoppy for a German brew).  If only the finish wasnt so bitter, this would be a 4+ beauty.

Whole Foods, Bowery 50cl ($6): Pours a brownish colour with a thick beige head. Aroma is kind of like an IPA that has been aged a little: darkish fruits, heavy malts, and earthy hops. Taste is very mildly sweet. Its also a bit bitter, and the bitterness sustains throughout the aftertaste. Hoppiness is mild, but certainly present. Something lingers. Not bad. I wish there were more doppelstickes and stickes around these parts.
drfat at Blue Monk & Pizza Plant. light to medium cola colored pour. Smoke notes, light cinnamon /allspice. sweet finish with hint of smoke. enjoyable
On tap. Fruity one here, lots of herbal noble hops. A delectable treat that is decadent for the style yet traditional.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a big off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, alcohol and chocolate. Flavor is sweet and malty with some sour red berries, raspberries and fruitiness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, chocolate and some sourness. Taste is light to medium sweet and light sour. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, from trade with fonefan. It pours an unclear, brown body under a finger-thick beige head. Lightly roasted aroma with some dried fruits and toffee. Piney hops too. Its lighlty lemony on the palate, with toffee, roasted malts and some dried fruits. Medium body, quite effervescent. Toffee and a roasted note in the end. Dont think it should have been lightly acidic, but its pleasant anyway. 120915

Bottle. Poured dark brown color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate toasted caramel malt and earthy hoparoma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium toasted balanced flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Complex beer.

16.9oz bottle, poured into a pint glass. Good thin khaki head. Very little lace. Sort of clear brown / red color. Lighter, smooth carbonation, very dry texture. Spicy hops, chocolate / caramel malts. Spicy bitter taste. Interesting, but not very rich nor drinkable.
Draft at Churchkey. Dark and clear maroon, thick beige head, solid lacing. Aroma of lightly spiced cocoa and coffee. Taste is nutmeg, allspice, bitter chocolate. Nice.

Draft.  Small beige head, clear dark red-brown body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, some toffee, plum.  Taste is moderately sweet, roast, toffee/caramel, some bittersweet chocolate.  Medium body, some stickiness.

Bottle 37.5cl. Dark brown hazy with a huge foamy lightbrown. Nice mix of fruits, nuts, chocolate, toast and roasted sence. Sweet taste with a nice complex ending, long time since I have had interesting beer like this, fun!
Fosca, amb notes torrefactes en boca. Lleugera i fàcil de beure. Per a tothom.

Pours amber with foamy tan head, nose of smoke, with bright green hops. flavors are rather hoppy and bitter with a wonderful smoke and roast underneath.  really out of style but great, like a alt mixed with a black ipa.
Bottle to taster at Dutchs. Looks good; a transparent Brown with resinous off-white lacing. Smells and tastes sweet and malty. Good on the palate. Enjoyable.

Bottle @ Rasmus House. Pours muddy brown with a light brown head. Aroma of straw, grass, caramel, light sourness. Flavor is malt, straw, grass, some sourness and rather bitter. Meium body, soft carbonation. Strange, but decent brew. 020812

Bottle, 7.5%. Muddy dark amber/brown with small creamy tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast, caramel and a little dark fruits. Flavour is malt, caramel, yeast, bitter, medium sweet, little nutty with notes of alcohol.
Unclear brown with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, dark malty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 020812

Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Cloudy amber muddy colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. caramellic. Modebitter flavior. Dry and woody. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate. Weird beer.
Bottle. Huge creamy head with excellent duration. Color is muddy brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, nuts, toasted malt and hops.
Bottle thanks to Yanick. Pours muddy brown with off white head. Nose/taste of gently smoked caramel malt, roasted malt, dark fruits and earthy hops. Medium body.

Draft at Spuyten with Linh and Andy. Pours a hazy brown body with off white head. Aroma is sweet caramel malts, dark fruit and roast. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of dark fruit, caramel malts, raisin, spice and light hop.
On tap at The Festival in Worcester, session 1. Hazy brown pour with a small off white head. Roasty popcorn kernel and earthy hop notes lead to a roasty medium bodied finish.

33cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Muddy dark brown colour, thick slightly rocky beige head. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, tart dark fruits, raisins, plums, figs, very malty, hint of chocolate. Flavour is very malty, sweet at first, quickly turns rather tart, sour even, dark fruits, firm hoppy almost metallic bitterness taking over in the finish. Fullbodied. Without the sourness (I dont think its intended, but who knows..) this couldve been really good I think, now its just OK.

(Bottle, 0.375 l - BBE 05/2012, at Pikkulintu, 20120612) The beer poured dark brown and quite clear. Aroma had malts, chocolate and hops. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were roasted malts, sweetness, chocolate, sourness and bitterness. Aftertaste was roasty, sour and bitter. Good aroma and not so enjoyable taste.

Bottle at Wildeman. Dark brown body with tan head. Malty nose. Quite bitter and sweet. Very interesting experimental beer with strong malts but also nice refreshing and bitter hops in there. Enjoyable.

(375ml bottle)  Pours a cloudy amber-brown body with a small off-white head.  Aroma of caramel, spoiled fruit, wood, and mustiness.  Flavor of orange peel, caramel, pepper, pine, raisins, and florals.

Bottle split with 77ships 
Head: creamy, small , off white  
Smell: hops, sugar, salty caramel, grassy, almost barley wine with lots of hops 
Taste: hopy with straight away a soury taste, some malts, bit of smoke , dry end , the bottle was probabbly infected , but truth has to be told , its been infected in a good way tough !

This is a beer to write a book about. Its taste is very complex and deep. Raisins, herbs, fruits, harsh - together with good, aromatic hops and some fresh sour. Wow. I payed 8 euros for this bottle (in Holland), its worth it.
bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, cloudy brown pour with coffee grounds and roasty aroma, flavor of fertilizer or chlorine, plant chlorophyll, perfumey, least favorite of the three

375 ml bottle. From bierkompass.de.
Dark murky brown colour with big fluffy tan head. 
Dark malty aroma with lots of resiny and fruity hops. Some bitterness. 
Flavour is fruity hoppy with raisins, fruit liqueur sweetness, strong dark maltiness, bitterness, ash, burned malt and more hoppiness. Nice complex brew. Theres some alcohol feeling in aftertaste.

(375ml bottle bb 03/12) hazy orange-brown with creamy tiny off-white bubbles. Nose of raisin, light sweet grain mash, quite malty, light perfume. Taset of light berry, saccharin, bit astringent and dry, medium to thick in body and a bitter linger thats creamy and well carbonated.

Wooden barrel @ Battersea BF 2012. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy yeasty aroma with hints of dark fruit and caramel. Sweetish fruity malty dark fruit flavor with hoppy hints. Has a fruity hoppy bitter dark fruit finish.

37.5 ml. bottle split with Belgbeergeek  purchased @ Alvinne: (A) dark brown with a touch of amber & red berry smooth plus seriously tanned head  (S) lots of sweet malts with plenty of caramel and quite a bit of hops integrated seamlessly into the whole, hint of red fruits, slight funkiness, once I have tasted it, I can get some sour malt from this but not before, the smell has nothing to do whatsoever with the taste, never had that before  (T) complete surprise after the smell, this reminds me of an oud bruin, this is a sour beer? probably infected but phenomenally infected, this beats the regular Rodenbach (closest comparison), sour oud bruin malt, mixed with sour red fruits, lots of berries, wood, slight mellow acidity, damn, this starts our really like an oud bruin leading into some moderate sweetness, sweeter malts, fruity, caramel, traces of americanish, slight grapefruit hops, this is freaking weird, love it  (B) medium, easy going sour body with still some malt characteristics, slightly dry & touch acidic  is Freigeist the German Fantôme

On Tap @ ACBF 2011

The beer in the glass is dark brown, slightly cloudy, with a fine, long-lasting creamy head. The smell is very hoppy bitter, but also with lots of aroma hops. The hop bomb explodes with the first sips! Very bitter, but also again with lots of delicious fruity aroma hops. The finish is a long drawn bitter hoppy. The further course is very hoppy bitter and dry, but the aroma hops still rule this beer!

375ml bottle (BierKompass.de)
Quite a muddy murky dark brown, cant really get any light through it. Absurd thick bready tan head. Very interesting aroma. Starts almost nettle-sharp and hoppy, reminiscent of some of the better danish hoppy beers, but then mellows nicely. Quite full palate, pleasant carbonation makes it almost refreshing. Retronasals are a touch soapy and bitter, and with some dry earthy barkiness. Hints of the nettles come back too. On swallowing, the soap comes back stronger, this time perfumed. The finish is very dry and quite dirty, but very nicely bitter, with a pleasant little tingle. Some slightly ashy dry burntness right at the end perhaps. It may be 7.5%, but its very subtle about it, theres no indication that this is a strong beerm only that it is a hefty beer. No flaws or harshness apart from the fact that Im not a huge fan of perfumed soap, but you kind of lose that detail amongst the general fullness of the taste. Nice to see a German brewer go "big" in this direction, rather than just cranking up the malt sugars in an N-pelbock. (thats supposed to be a generalisation of doppel, tripel, quadrupel, etc...)

Bottle. Deep mahogany colour with a lasting medium-sized off-white head. Fruity hoppy aroma with malty notes. Flavour is fruit, sweet malt, caramel and hint of alcohol. Some bitterness in the finish, medium to full-bodied.

In short: An herbal, spicy and nutty IPA-ish brown beer.  Fun beer, whatever it is.
How: Bottle 375ml, Consumed probably fresh a few weeks after purchase directly from the source
The look: Cloudy mahogany-burgundy body topped by a large beige head with good retention
In long: Nose is bursting with herbal and grassy hops.  Taste has a nice nutty malt backbone (like roasted cashews and almonds) and a bit of caramel.  Then the assertive hops bite the tongue with a sharp herbal bitterness of medium-high intensity.  Certainly not what I expect from an Altbier (current ratebeer classification) because of its aggressive hopping and spiciness but Im not sure what I would call it Some kind of bastard nutty IPA.  I really enjoyed this beer.  I was very worried when I opened this Hoppeditz because days before I was disgusted by their awful Caulfield and Caulfield Not Just Plain Vanilla.  But to my great joy I really enjoyed this one.  So at first I was very worried and then I was relieved, like when I was very worried because I had writers block but then I was relieved when I realized I wasnt a writer.
At ACBF 2011.  Cloudy brown colour.  Perfumed hop aroma.  Its pretty decent, hop, toffee, lavender on finish.  Its got some perpper.  Hoppy as hell.  Interesting.

375 ml bottle with intriguing artwork on the label and freshness date March 2013, into tulip. Pours clear, coppery-brown body with slight haze to it, topped by creamy, mid-sized stable off white head that fades to a firm cloth and gets revived with each swirl. Complex and rich aroma of malt with caramel, toasty and melanoidin-like qualities, peppery, earthy hops with slight citrusy notes and esters of dark fruits such as plum that managed to survive the lagering period.
The assertive bitterness of hops - that provide moderate peppery spiciness with a touch of citrus rind - is counterbalanced by malts attenuated enough to pave the way to a dry, everlasting bitter finish with nutty notes and slight astringency. Body is medium to full with moderate carbonation. This is a dark, reach and strong Altibier, undoubtly a Sticke. Yes, I will stick to it.

In short: a rich and complex, bitter yet sweet, spicy Altbier on pair with the best of its kind. Its a pity that reviewers on this site dont rate to style because this beer deserves a lot more than just currently weighted average of 3.25.
